metadata.scenario_description: Morning circle time begins calmly with 6 children and 2 adults. The teacher leads a singing activity. Around minute 3, construction noise begins outside the window (drilling). Child_3, who has high sensory sensitivity, starts showing signs of distress - first covering ears, then rocking. The teaching assistant notices and guides child_3 to the sensory corner. Meanwhile, child_1 and child_2 are engaged in the activity and attempt to interact with each other. By minute 8, the drilling stops, and child_3 is supported back to the group with a fidget toy. The session ends with a calming song.

layer1_events.transcription: בואו נתחיל עם השיר של הבוקר
מי זוכר את השיר על הפרחים?
בואו נעשה את התנועה של הפרח
הם עובדים בחוץ, זה יעבור בקרוב
זה יעזור לך להרגיש טוב יותר
בואו נסיים עם שיר יפה ושקט

layer2_events.activity_description: morning circle time with singing activity

layer2_events.description: enthusiastic participation in group singing activity
layer2_events.trigger_description: teacher asking who remembers the flower song

layer2_events.description: eager verbal response to teacher's question with physical engagement
participating in group singing with appropriate verbal contribution
self-soothing rocking while remaining engaged in activity
approached peer and made eye contact during group activity
engaged in mutual eye contact and verbal exchange about activity

layer2_events.activity_description: ongoing singing disrupted by external construction noise

layer2_events.description: initial signs of distress in response to loud drilling noise
layer2_events.trigger_description: high intensity drilling noise from outside

layer2_events.description: verbal inquiry about disturbing noise showing awareness and concern
escalating distress with rocking and orientation away from group
crying and self-soothing behaviors indicating sensory overwhelm
adult recognizes distress and offers transition to sensory corner
accepting adult guidance and moving to sensory area

layer2_events.activity_description: main group continues while one child receives individual support
layer2_events.adult_attention_focus: split between group and individual child

layer2_events.description: child shows concern and asks about peer who left group
demonstrates understanding and empathy about peer's needs
using sensory supports and adult proximity for regulation
peer-to-peer invitation to participate together in group activity
enthusiastic acceptance of peer invitation showing positive social engagement
showing signs of calming and improved regulation in sensory area
checking in on child's emotional state and regulation progress

layer2_events.activity_description: noise subsided, preparing for child to rejoin group

layer2_events.description: accepting fidget toy as regulation tool for group reintegration
layer2_events.trigger_description: adult providing fidget toy for support

layer2_events.description: welcoming peer back to group with positive verbal greeting
successful social reengagement with peer through greeting and eye contact

layer2_events.activity_description: concluding with calm, quiet song for regulation

layer2_events.description: using fidget toy successfully while participating in group ending

layer2_events.activity_description: positive conclusion with praise for all children
